alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Franklin; Licking (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 9:15PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN FRANKLIN, NORTHWESTERN FAIRFIELD AND SOUTHWESTERN LICKING COUNTIES THROUGH 945 PM EDT... At 914 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Reynoldsburg, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Newark, Reynoldsburg, Gahanna, Pickerington, Bexley, Heath, Granville, Pataskala, Canal Winchester, Groveport, Buckeye Lake, Hebron, Granville South, Beechwood Trails, Summit Station, Whitehall, Etna, New Albany and Jersey. This includes I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 106 and 128. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
